00020 /// @file  apt-file5-equivalent.cpp
00021 /// @brief Simple program to check that two HDF5 files are equivalent.
00022 
00023 //
00024 #include "file/TsvFile/TsvFile.h"
00025 #include "file5/File5.h"
00026 #include "util/AptVersionInfo.h"
00027 #include "util/Convert.h"
00028 #include "util/Err.h"
00029 #include "util/Fs.h"
00030 #include "util/PgOptions.h"
00031 #include "util/Util.h"
00032 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00033 //
00034 #include <cstring>
00035 #include <map>
00036 #include <string>
00037 #include <vector>
00038 #include <list>
00039 
00040 using namespace std;
00041 
00042 
00043 void define_aptfile5Equiv_options(PgOptions* opts)
00044 {
00045   opts->setUsage("apt-file5-equivalent - check to see if two HDF5 files contain equivalent values.\n\n"
00046                  "This can be annoying to do with a regular diff as differences in \n"
00047                  "precision and compiler rounding errors can lead to representational \n"
00048                  "differences for two numbers that are the same (i.e. 1.0 == 0.99999981).\n\n"
00049                  "usage:\n"
00050                  "   apt-file5-equivalent -epsilon 0.001 -c 0.9999 file1.cychp file2.cychp");
00051                  
00052   opts->defineOption("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00053                      "This message.",
00054                      "false");
00055   opts->defineOption("i", "ignore-columns-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00056                      "Path to TSV file with list of columns to ignore.\n" 
00057                                          "(One column with header line IgnoreColumns)",
00058                      "");
00059   opts->defineOption("d", "datasets-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00060                      "Path to TSV file with list of datasets to compare.\n" 
00061                                          "(Two columns with header line GroupName TsvName)",
00062                      "");
00063   opts->defineOption("e", "epsilon", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00064                      "Epsilon tolerance to differences.",
00065                      ".001");
00066   opts->defineOption("c", "correlation", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00067                      "Correlation tolerance to differences.",
00068                      "1.0");
00069   opts->defineOption("v", "version", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00070                      "Display version information.",
00071                      "false");
00072   opts->defineOption("n", "report-nan-num-diff", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00073                      "Report differences between NaN and non-NaN values.",
00074                      "false");
00075   opts->defineOption("s", "sign-allow-negation", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00076                      "Allow sign difference between pairs of values compared.\n",
00077                      "false");
00078 }
00079 
00080 /**
00081  * Check data in all sections of binary HDF5 file to determine eqivalence.
00082  *
00083  * @param opts - Options supplied to program.
00084  * @return status 0 if equivalent, non-zero if not not equivalent.
00085  */
00086 int file5Equiv(PgOptions *opts) {
00087   std::string setIgnoreFile = opts->get("ignore-columns-file");
00088   std::string datasetsFile = opts->get("datasets-file");
00089   double dEpsilon = opts->getDouble("epsilon");
00090   double dCorrelationCutoff = opts->getDouble("correlation");
00091   bool bFlagNaNNumDiff = opts->getBool("report-nan-num-diff");
00092   bool bAllowNegation = opts->getBool("sign-allow-negation");
00093   if(opts->getArgCount() != 2) {
00094     Err::errAbort("Must have exactly two file name arguments.");
00095   }
00096   std::string strFileName1 = opts->getArg(0);
00097   std::string strFileName2 = opts->getArg(1);
00098   Verbose::setLevel(2);
00099   // load list of columns to ignore from text file, example for list "Cyto2.Parameters.Parameter"
00100   std::set<std::string> setIgnore;
00101   if(setIgnoreFile!="") {
00102     std::vector<std::string> vectorIgnore;
00103     affx::TsvFile::extractColToVec(setIgnoreFile,"IgnoreColumns",&vectorIgnore);
00104     // copy vector to set required by interface
00105     vector <std::string>::iterator vectorIgnore_Iter = vectorIgnore.begin();
00106     for( vectorIgnore_Iter=vectorIgnore.begin() ; vectorIgnore_Iter!=vectorIgnore.end() ; vectorIgnore_Iter++ ) {
00107       setIgnore.insert(*vectorIgnore_Iter);
00108         }
00109     Verbose::out(1, "Read " + ToStr(setIgnore.size()) + " ignored parameters from: " + Fs::basename(setIgnoreFile));
00110   }
00111   std::vector<std::string> vectorGroupName;
00112   std::vector<std::string> vectorTsvName;
00113   // load list GroupName-TsvName for datasets to compare
00114   if(datasetsFile!="") {
00115     affx::TsvFile::extractColToVec(datasetsFile,"GroupName",&vectorGroupName);
00116     affx::TsvFile::extractColToVec(datasetsFile,"TsvName",&vectorTsvName);
00117     Verbose::out(1, "Read " + ToStr(vectorGroupName.size()) + " GroupName-TsvName value pairs from: " + Fs::basename(datasetsFile));
00118   }
00119   // compare HDF5 files
00120   bool bPassed = true;
00121   vector <std::string>::iterator vectorGroupName_Iter = vectorGroupName.begin();
00122   vector <std::string>::iterator vectorTsvName_Iter = vectorTsvName.begin();
00123   for( vectorGroupName_Iter=vectorGroupName.begin() ; vectorGroupName_Iter!=vectorGroupName.end() ; vectorGroupName_Iter++ ) {
00124     if (!affx::File5_File::equivalent(strFileName1, strFileName2, *vectorGroupName_Iter, *vectorTsvName_Iter, setIgnore, dEpsilon, dCorrelationCutoff, bAllowNegation, bFlagNaNNumDiff) ) {
00125       bPassed = false;
00126       Verbose::out(1, "File5 " + *vectorGroupName_Iter + "." + *vectorTsvName_Iter + " Comparison failed\n" \
00127                   "for files "+strFileName1 + "\n" + \
00128                   "      and "+strFileName2);
00129     }
00130     vectorTsvName_Iter++;
00131   }
00132 
00133   // A return of 0 is good, 1 is bad.
00134   return ! bPassed;
00135 }
00136 
00137 /** Everybody's favorite function. */
00138 int main(int argc, const char *argv[]) {
00139   try {
00140   const string version = AptVersionInfo::versionToReport();
00141 
00142   int same = 0;
00143 
00144   PgOptions *opts = NULL;
00145   opts = new PgOptions();
00146   define_aptfile5Equiv_options(opts);
00147   opts->parseArgv(argv);
00148 
00149   // Do we need help?
00150   if(opts->getBool("help") || argc == 1) {
00151     opts->usage();
00152     cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00153   }
00154   else if(opts->getBool("version")) {
00155     cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00156   }
00157   else {
00158     same = file5Equiv(opts);
00159   }
00160   delete opts;
00161   return same;
00162   } 
00163   catch(...) {
00164     Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00165     return 1;
00166   }
00167 }
